p: A report on the first case cluster of novel coronavirus infection implicated a seafood market in Wuhan, PR China [ 12]. Subsequent spread out of Wuhan province was then associated with propagation of epidemic SARS-CoV-2 infection [ 13]. In other parts of China, a similar disease spectrum emerged, with a notable reduction in the estimated mortality rate [ 14]. Once outside China, COVID-19 spread was rapid, leading to new national epidemics in distant locations such as the World Health Organization (WHO) European region [ 15]. A consistent clinical picture emerged in which more severe infections affect older patients with cough, expectoration, chest pain, dyspnoea and a higher computed tomography (CT) score [ 16]. Indeed, CT appearance appears to correlate with SARS-CoV-2 PCR assay results [ 17]. We can expect further reports of the common features of COVID-19 case clusters, national outbreaks and their corresponding laboratory investigations in weeks to come.
